speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: SCENE II. Before the council-chamber. Pursuivants, Pages,  and c.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: attending.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Enter CRANMER

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: I hope I am not too late; and yet the gentleman,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: That was sent to me from the council, pray'd me

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: To make great haste. All fast? what means this? Ho!

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Who waits there? Sure, you know me?

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Enter Keeper

speaker: Keeper
text_entry: Yes, my lord;

speaker: Keeper
text_entry: But yet I cannot help you.

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Why?

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Enter DOCTOR BUTTS

speaker: Keeper
text_entry: Your grace must wait till you be call'd for.

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: So.

speaker: DOCTOR BUTTS
text_entry: [Aside]  This is a piece of malice. I am glad

speaker: DOCTOR BUTTS
text_entry: I came this way so happily: the king

speaker: DOCTOR BUTTS
text_entry: Shall understand it presently.

speaker: DOCTOR BUTTS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: [Aside] 'Tis Butts,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: The king's physician: as he pass'd along,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: How earnestly he cast his eyes upon me!

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Pray heaven, he sound not my disgrace! For certain,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: This is of purpose laid by some that hate me--

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: God turn their hearts! I never sought their malice--

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: To quench mine honour: they would shame to make me

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Wait else at door, a fellow-counsellor,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: 'Mong boys, grooms, and lackeys. But their pleasures

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Must be fulfill'd, and I attend with patience.

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Enter the KING HENRY VIII and DOCTOR BUTTS at a window above

speaker: DOCTOR BUTTS
text_entry: I'll show your grace the strangest sight--

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: What's that, Butts?

speaker: DOCTOR BUTTS
text_entry: I think your highness saw this many a day.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Body o' me, where is it?

speaker: DOCTOR BUTTS
text_entry: There, my lord:

speaker: DOCTOR BUTTS
text_entry: The high promotion of his grace of Canterbury;

speaker: DOCTOR BUTTS
text_entry: Who holds his state at door, 'mongst pursuivants,

speaker: DOCTOR BUTTS
text_entry: Pages, and footboys.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Ha! 'tis he, indeed:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Is this the honour they do one another?

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: 'Tis well there's one above 'em yet. I had thought

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: They had parted so much honesty among 'em

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: At least, good manners, as not thus to suffer

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: A man of his place, and so near our favour,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To dance attendance on their lordships' pleasures,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And at the door too, like a post with packets.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: By holy Mary, Butts, there's knavery:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Let 'em alone, and draw the curtain close:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: We shall hear more anon.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Exeunt
